content.heading: OHLCV
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset pairs.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The timestamp associated with this record in UTC.
The price at which the first trade occurred during the specified period.
The highest price at which a trade took place during the period.
The lowest price at which a trade occurred during the period.
The price at which the last trade occurred during the specified period.
The total quantity traded during the period.

content.heading: Example
Order Book Events
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset pairs.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The time at which the order book event took place.
The nano second part of the timestampMilliseconds, where applicable.
The quote price of the asset pair.
The number of assets traded in a specific asset pair within a given period of time.
Indicates if it is a bid or ask order: true for a bid and false for an ask.
A unique identifier for the order book event.

content.heading: Example
Order Book Snapshots
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset pairs.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The time at which the order book snapshot took place.
Indicates if it is a bid or ask order: true for a bid and false for an ask.
The quote price of the asset pair.
The number of assets traded in a specific asset pair within a given period of time.
The number of orders aggregated at this price level.
A unique identifier associated with this snapshot.

content.heading: Example
Price Updates
Request

tr.td: The asset pair by which to filter.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: true if pair has been delisted. false otherwise.
The dollar value change in price since last update.
true if pair is new. false otherwise.
The price at time of last update.
The time of the last update.
The quote price of the asset pair.
The time at which the price change took place.
true if price hasn't changed since last update. false otherwise.

content.heading: Example
Prices
Request

tr.td: The asset pair by which to filter.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The quote price of the asset pair.
The time at which the price change took place.

content.heading: Example
Tickers Snapshots
content.paragraph: This subscription delivers 1-second snapshots. For each instrument/pair and exchange, we emit at most one update per second, using the first ticker event observed in that UTC-second. If your workflow requires event-level (tick-by-tick) tickers, they are available on our Enterprise plan. Please contact your Amberdata sales representative for details.
content.heading: Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset pairs.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The exchange provided timestamp at which the trade took place.
The exchange provided nano second part of the exchangeTimestamp (if available from the exchange).
The sequence number (equal to null if it is not provided by the exchange).

content.heading: Example
Trades
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset pairs.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The time at which the trade took place.
The nano second part of the timestampMilliseconds, where applicable.
The unique id given by an exchange.
The quote price of the asset pair.
The number of assets traded in a specific asset pair within a given period of time.
Indicates if it is a buy or sell trade: true for a buy trade and false for a sell.

content.heading: Example
Funding Rates
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset instruments.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The time at which the funding rate took place.
The time at which the funding rate insert to database
The next funding rate for which data is available.
The next funding time for which data is available.
If true, then it's the actual funding rate that has been realized and applied. If false, then it's a projected/estimated funding rate for an upcoming funding interval.

content.heading: Example
Insurance Funds
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset instruments.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The time at which the insurance fund took place.

content.heading: Example
Liquidations
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset instruments.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The time at which the liquidation took place.
The price at which the liquidation occurred.
Indicates whether the liquidated position was a buy or sell.
The status of the order at the time of the message.
The type of order that was liquidated.
Describes how long an order will remain active before it is executed or expires.
This field will show as null for all exchanges except Bitmex.
An identifier for the specific order that was liquidated (this field will show as null for most exchanges except Deribit and Bitmex).
The amount of the asset that was liquidated.

content.heading: Example
Long/Short Ratios
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset instruments.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The time at which the long/short ratio was updated.
The proportion of accounts on the long side of the futures contract.
The proportion of accounts on the short side of the futures contract.
The frequency of the timeInterval. When timeInterval=minutes, the period is 5, indicating 5 minutes. When timeInterval=days, the period is 1, indicating 1 day.

content.heading: Example
OHLCV
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset instruments.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The timestamp associated with this record in UTC.
The price at which the first trade occurred during the specified period.
The highest price at which a trade took place during the period.
The lowest price at which a trade occurred during the period.
The price at which the last trade occurred during the specified period.
The total quantity traded during the period.

content.heading: Example
Open Interest
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset instruments.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The time at which the data was received.
The total open interest for the specified instrument.

content.heading: Example
Order Book Events
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset instruments.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The timestamp at which the order book event took place.
The timestamp at which the event was recorded by the exchange.
The nanosecond timestamp at which the event was recorded by the exchange.
The timestamp for when the update was received by our system.
The nanosecond timestamp for when the update was received by our system.
A boolean value indicating whether the data pertains to bid orders (true) or ask orders (false).
The price level of the order(s).
The quantity of the contract(s) at that price level.
The number of individual orders at the specified price level.
A unique identifier for the order book event.

content.heading: Example
Order Book Snapshots
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset instruments. (OPTIONAL)

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The time at which the order book snapshot took place.
The timestamp at which the event was recorded by the exchange.
A boolean indicator of whether the orders in the snapshot are buy (bid) orders.
The price level of the order.
The quantity of the asset available at the specified price level.
The number of individual orders that are aggregated at the specified price level.
A unique identifier for the order book state.
The current funding rate for perpetual futures contracts.

content.heading: Example
Tickers Snapshots
content.paragraph: This subscription delivers 1-second snapshots. For each instrument/pair and exchange, we emit at most one update per second, using the first ticker event observed in that UTC-second. If your workflow requires event-level (tick-by-tick) tickers, they are available on our Enterprise plan. Please contact your Amberdata sales representative for details.
content.heading: Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset instruments.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The exchange provided nanosecond part of the exchangeTimestamp (if available from the exchange).
The timestamp at which the event took place.
The sequence number (equal to null if it is not provided by the exchange).
The last volume for the instrument.
The order size of the best bid.
The order size of the best ask.

content.heading: Example
Trades
Request

tr.td: The exchange for which to retrieve asset instruments.

content.heading: Response

tr.td: The timestamp at which the event was recorded by the exchange.
The nanosecond timestamp at which the event was recorded by the exchange.
A boolean value indicating the direction of the trade from the perspective of the initiator.
The total amount of the quote asset of the instrument that was traded.
The price at which the futures contract was traded.
The quantity of the contract that was traded.
A unique identifier for this specific trade.

content.heading: Example
